docs.text: this " dumb " cowboy blondie who thinks he is a `darn' good loverboy , decides to leave his dusty ol' town somewhere in texas and go to new york .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he puts on his beloved cowboy attire and off he hops on the next new york coach .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when he arrives to new york , he immediately sets out to play mr playboy thinking he is the best `darn' `stud' in the whol'o' new york city .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: obviously he fails .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he meets the 'cripple' rico ( dustin hoffman , who is terrifically good ) in a bar .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: rico has a leg that is paralysed from the knee down , so he walks in a peculiar way .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: rico is a thief and wants to get some money off this 'rich' dumb cowboy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he cheats our cowboy out of $20 through a somewhat detailed routine and disappears .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: soon , our cowboy runs out of money : he gets kicked out of his hotel , and starts getting hungry .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: walking through the city , with " everybody's talkin' " playing in the background ( oh , and his prided techno transistor radio in hand ) , he spots rico in a cafe .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: rico , half-scared , pours out all the money in his pocket .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: 60 filthy cents .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: our cowboy , hungry , is forgiving .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he is glad he found someone he knows .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: rico offers to make it up for him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and he invites him to his place .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and what a filthy , cold place it is .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: our cowboy falls asleep instantly in the ( junk ) bed .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when he finally wakes ( jumps ? )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: up , he finds rico looking at him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " you wanna cup'a'coffee ? "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: rico asks in his friendly , sleazy , somewhat-childish manner while he smokes on a ciggy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " what're you ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a goddamn faggot ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what do you want from me ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: where are my shoes ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what did you do to them ? "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but all his doubts turn out to be unfounded .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: rico really has a heart .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: together , they live in the junk apartment and almost freeze to death .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: rico is convinced that the best place to be is florida , where the sun shines beautifully and there are lots of coconut trees .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but he falls sick and is convinced that his cure is to go to florida .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " we will soon be in miami " is the last sentence uttered in this film and what a shocking , moving end of a film it is .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the classic theme music : " midnight cowboy " helps bring about the feeling of attachment that most viewers will experience towards the end of the film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: whether the attachment is to the two main characters or to their dreams , is probably as debatable as whether it was the acting or the direction that makes this film so memorable .
docs.label: positive
